column4: Hey guys, I downloaded the latest Ubuntu Distro and booted it but when I do the computer I boot it on looses internet as well as every other computer in the house
So I select DHCP from the network settings dropdown list but it still doesnt work
Do I have to install ubuntu to my hdd for the internet to work
I have the same problem I have to use dhcpcd to fix it
which requires installing it to hdd right?
I would think so, but you maybe able to install it to ram if you have enough memory
no just run synaptic as root and find it in the list it is a one click install like most apps in ubuntu
How am I supposed to fix my internet not working, when what I have to do involved using the internet
that is if you install to hdd
sorry i forgot you are on live-cd
how can I set up dhcpcd without using the internet?
the only way you could install dhcpcd without network con. is by storing to deb (install) file on another cd or something
